qas.question: What organization did the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation donate $280 million to?
Policymakers believe tax incentives, market commitments, and what third incentive will speed up vaccine development?
What group with the initials SATVI is researching TB vaccines?
What nonprofit tuberculosis research foundation has a verb in its name?
Who gave the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation $280 mil?
What is the prize for vaccine development set at?

plausible_answers.text: the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation

qas.question: Who gifted Stop TB Partnership a large amount of money for improving vaccinations?
Where is Stop TB Partnership working?

context: To encourage further discovery, researchers and policymakers are promoting new economic models of vaccine development, including <a1_0>prizes<a1_0/>, tax incentives, and advance market commitments. A number of groups, including the <a3_0>Stop TB Partnership<a3_0/>, the <a2_0>South African Tuberculosis Vaccine Initiative<a2_0/>, and the Aeras Global TB Vaccine Foundation, are involved with research. Among these, the <a0_0><b4_0>Aeras Global TB Vaccine Foundation<b4_0/><a0_0/> received a gift of more than <b5_0>$280 million<b5_0/> (US) from <b6_0>the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation<b6_0/> to develop and license an improved vaccine against tuberculosis for use in <b7_0>high burden countries<b7_0/>.
